homepage_h2:
daisyUI es el plugin de Tailwind CSS que amarás!
Proporciona útiles nombres de clase de componentes
para ayudarte a escribir menos código y construir más rápido.
In a Tailwind CSS project, you need to w: En un proyecto Tailwind CSS, debe escribir nombres de clase de utilidad para cada elemento. Miles de nombres de clase solo para dar estilo a los elementos más básicos.
instead of writing<br /> <span class='te:
en lugar de escribir
100 nombres de clase
For every element, every page, every pro:
Para cada elemento, cada página, cada proyecto,
una y otra vez
use <span class='text-success'><span cla: use nombres de clase semánticos
It's descriptive, faster, cleaner and ea: Es descriptivo, más rápido, más limpio y más fácil de mantener.
Use Tailwind CSS but write fewer class n: Usa Tailwind CSS pero escribe menos nombres de clase.
Pure CSS. <br />No JS dependency: CSS puro. Sin dependencia de JS
daisyUI adds class names to Tailwind CSS:
daisyUI agrega nombres de clase a Tailwind CSS
para todos los componentes de UI comunes.
Nombres de clase como
This allows us to focus on important thi:
Esto nos permite enfocarnos en cosas importantes
en lugar de estilizar elementos básicos para cada proyecto.
Write fewer class names<br />Use compone:
Escriba menos nombres de clase
Utilice nombres de clase de componentes
modifíquelos usando utilidades Tailwind CSS.
With daisyUI, you write 88% fewer class:
Con daisyUI, escribe un 88% menos de nombres de clase
Y el tamaño de su HTML será aproximadamente un 79% más pequeño.
Powered by Tailwind&nbsp;CSS utility&nbs: Impulsado por Tailwind CSS clases de utilidad
daisyUI is built on top of Tailwind&nbsp:
daisyUI está construido sobre Tailwind CSS
para que pueda personalizar todo
usando clases de utilidad.
daisyUI is a plugin for Tailwind CSS. It: daisyUI es un complemento para Tailwind CSS. Funciona en todos los frameworks JS y no necesita un archivo de paquete JS.
Install daisyUI as a dev dependency and: Instale daisyUI como una dependencia de dev y use los nombres de clase como cualquier otro nombre de clase de Tailwind CSS.
Your website should be unique. Create a: Su sitio web debe ser único. Cree un tema personalizado para usted mismo usando el generador de temas daisyUI. Los colores que elija se aplicarán a todos los componentes de daisyUI.
Mix and match daisyUI class names to cre: Mezcla y combina los nombres de las clases daisyUI para crear páginas web únicas.
daisyUI is the most popular<br />compone: daisyUI es la biblioteca de componentes más popular para Tailwind CSS
open-source projects using daisyUI: proyectos de código abierto que utilizan daisyUI
Also, using semantic color names makes t: Además, el uso de nombres de colores semánticos facilita la creación de temas. No tendría que definir colores de modo oscuro para cada elemento y no estaría limitado solo a temas claros/oscuros. puede tener varios temas disponibles y cada tema tiene solo unas pocas líneas de variables CSS.
Accordion is used for showing and hiding: Accordion is used for showing and hiding content but only one item can stay open at a time.
All radio inputs with the same name work: All radio inputs with the same name work together and only one of them can be open at a time. If you have more than one set of accordion items on a page, use different names for the radio inputs on each set.
Alert informs users about important even: Alert informa a los usuarios sobre eventos importantes.
Avatars are used to show a thumbnail rep: Avatars se utilizan para mostrar una representación en miniatura de una persona o empresa en la interfaz.
Badges are used to inform the user of th: Badges se utilizan para informar al usuario sobre el estado de datos específicos.
Breadcrumbs helps users to navigate thro: Breadcrumbs ayudan a los usuarios a navegar por el sitio web.
Buttons allow the user to take actions o: Buttons permiten al usuario realizar acciones o elegir opciones.
Cards are used to group and display cont: Cards se utilizan para agrupar y mostrar contenido de una manera que sea fácil de leer.
Carousel show images or content in a scr: Carousel muestra imágenes o contenido en un área desplazable.
Chat bubbles are used to show one line o: Los bocadillos de chat se utilizan para mostrar una línea de conversación y todos sus datos, incluida la imagen del autor, el nombre del autor, la hora, etc.
Checkboxes are used to select or deselec: Checkboxes se utilizan para seleccionar o anular la selección de un valor.
Collapse is used for showing and hiding: Collapse se utiliza para mostrar y ocultar contenido.
Diff component shows a side-by-side comp: Diff component shows a side-by-side comparison of two items.
Divider will be used to separate content: Divider se utilizará para separar el contenido vertical u horizontalmente.
Drawer is a grid layout that can show/hi: Drawer es un diseño de cuadrícula que puede mostrar/ocultar una barra lateral en el lado izquierdo o derecho de la página.
Dropdown can open a menu or any other el: Dropdown puede abrir un menú o cualquier otro elemento cuando se hace clic en el botón.
File Input is a an input field for uploa: File Input es un campo de entrada para subir archivos.
Footer can contain logo, copyright notic: Footer puede contener un logotipo, un aviso de copyright y enlaces a otras páginas.
Hero is a component for displaying a lar: Hero es un componente para mostrar un cuadro grande o una imagen con un título y una descripción.
Indicators are used to place an element: Indicators se utilizan para colocar un elemento en la esquina de otro elemento.
Text Input es un campo de entrada simple.
Kbd is used to display keyboard shortcut: Kbd se utiliza para mostrar atajos de teclado.
Link adds the missing underline style to: Link agrega el estilo de subrayado faltante a los enlaces.
Loading shows an animation to indicate t: Loading shows an animation to indicate that something is loading.
Mask crops the content of the element to: Mask recorta el contenido del elemento a formas comunes.
Menu is used to display a list of links: Menu se utiliza para mostrar una lista de enlaces vertical u horizontalmente.
Browser mockup shows a box that looks li: Browser mockup shows a box that looks like a browser window.
Code mockup is used to show a block of c: El Mockup de código se usa para mostrar un bloque de código en un cuadro que parece un editor de código.
Phone mockup shows a mockup of an iPhone: El Mockup de teléfono muestra una maqueta de un iPhone.
Window mockup shows a box that looks lik: El Mockup de ventana muestra un cuadro que parece una ventana del sistema operativo.
Modal is used to show a dialog or a box: Modal se usa para mostrar un cuadro de diálogo o un cuadro cuando hace clic en un botón.
Navbar is used to show a navigation bar: Navbar se utiliza para mostrar una barra de navegación en la parte superior de la página.
Pagination is a group of buttons that al: La paginación es un grupo de botones que permiten al usuario navegar entre un conjunto de contenidos relacionados.
Progress bar can be used to show the pro: Progress bar se puede utilizar para mostrar el progreso de una tarea o para mostrar el paso del tiempo.
Radial progress can be used to show the: Radial progress se puede utilizar para mostrar el progreso de una tarea o para mostrar el paso del tiempo.
Radio buttons allow the user to select o: Radio buttons permiten al usuario seleccionar una opción de un conjunto.
Range slider is used to select a value b: Range slider se utiliza para seleccionar un valor deslizando un controlador.
Rating is a set of radio buttons that al: Rating es un conjunto de botones de radio que permiten al usuario calificar algo.
Select is used to pick a value from a li: Select se utiliza para elegir un valor de una lista de opciones.
Skeleton is a component that can be used: Skeleton is a component that can be used to show a loading state of a component.
Stack visually puts elements on top of e: Stack coloca elementos visualmente uno encima del otro.
Steps can be used to show a list of step: Steps se pueden utilizar para mostrar una lista de pasos en un proceso.
Swap allows you to toggle the visibility: Swap le permite alternar la visibilidad de dos elementos usando una casilla de verificación o un nombre de clase.
Tabs can be used to show a list of links: Tabs se pueden usar para mostrar una lista de enlaces en formato de pestañas.
Table can be used to show a list of data: Table se puede utilizar para mostrar una lista de datos en formato de tabla.
Textarea allows users to enter text in m: Textarea permite a los usuarios ingresar texto en varias líneas.
If a checked checkbox input or a checked: If a checked checkbox input or a checked radio input with theme-controller class exists in the page, The page will have the same theme as that input's value.
Timeline component shows a list of event: Timeline component shows a list of events in chronological order.
Toast is a wrapper to stack elements, po: Toast es un envoltorio para apilar elementos, posicionados en la esquina de la página.
Toggle is a checkbox that is styled to l: Toggle es una casilla de verificación diseñada para parecerse a un interruptor.
Tooltip can be used to show a message wh: Tooltip se puede utilizar para mostrar un mensaje al pasar el cursor sobre un elemento.
Just add one of these to the <code>head<: Simplemente agregue uno de estos a la etiqueta head de su HTML
How to use daisyUI from a CDN?: How to use daisyUI from a CDN?
daisyUI is fully themeable and colorable: daisyUI es totalmente tematizable y coloreable,
So instead of using constant color utili: Entonces, en lugar de usar clases de utilidad de color constante como:
It's suggested to use semantic color uti: Se sugiere utilizar clases de utilidad de color semántico como:
Each color name contains CSS variables a: Cada nombre de color contiene variables CSS y cada tema daisyUI aplica valores de color a las clases de utilidad cuando se aplica.
Semantic color names make more sense bec: Los nombres de colores semánticos tienen más sentido porque cuando diseñamos interfaces, no usamos cualquier color al azar. Definimos una paleta de colores específica con nombres como primario, secundario, etc. y usamos solo esos colores específicos en nuestras interfaces.
List of all daisyUI color names: Lista de todos los nombres de color de daisyUI
You can use these color names in your th: Puede usar estos nombres de colores en su tema o en clases de utilidad.
Some daisyUI components come with modifi: Algunos componentes daisyUI vienen con nombres de clase de modificador y ese nombre de clase de modificador aplicará un color.
You can also use color names in utility: También puede usar nombres de colores en clases de utilidad, al igual que los nombres de colores originales de Tailwind.
These are utility classes that can be us: Estas son clases de utilidad que se pueden usar con un nombre de color:
How to change the default configuration: ¿Cómo cambiar la configuración predeterminada de daisyUI?
daisyUI components come with many varian: Los componentes daisyUI vienen con muchas variantes necesarias para los sistemas de diseño y, por lo general, no necesitará personalizar nada.
But you can still customize components i: Pero aún puede personalizar los componentes de muchas maneras.
Let's say, you want to customize this bu: Digamos que desea personalizar este botón:
You can use daisyUI utility classes:: Puede usar las clases de utilidad de daisyUI:
You can use Tailwind's utility classes:: Puede utilizar las clases de utilidad de Tailwind:
You can customize components on your CSS: Puede personalizar componentes en su archivo CSS, utilizando la directiva @apply de Tailwind.
Install daisyUI as a Tailwind CSS plugin: Instale daisyUI como un complemento de Tailwind CSS
You need <a target=_blank' href='https:/: Necesita Node.js y Tailwind CSS instalado.
How to install daisyUI as a Tailwind CSS: ¿Cómo instalar daisyUI como complemento de Tailwind CSS?
See example setup of daisyUI and Tailwin: Vea la configuración de ejemplo de daisyUI y Tailwind CSS en diferentes marcos de trabajo y herramientas de compilación.
How to use layouts and typography in dai: Cómo usar maquetas y tipografía en daisyUI
Layout, sizing, grids, spacing, etc. all: La disposición, el tamaño, las cuadrículas, el espaciado, etc., serán manejados por las clases de utilidad de Tailwind CSS.
How to use a theme only for a section of: ¿Cómo usar un tema solo para una sección de la página?
Add <code>data-theme='THEME_NAME'</code>: Agregue data-theme='THEME_NAME' a cualquier elemento y todo lo que esté dentro tendrá su tema.
You can nest themes and there is no limi: ¡Puedes anidar temas y no hay límite!
You can force a section of your HTML to: Puede obligar a una sección de su HTML a usar solo un tema específico.
How to add custom styles for a specific: How to add custom styles for a specific theme?
You can write custom style for your elem: You can write custom style for your elements only for a specific theme.
Add component classes to your HTML: Agregue clases de componentes a su HTML
How to use daisyUI classes to style your: ¿Cómo usar las clases daisyUI para diseñar tu página?
Once you <a href='/docs/install/'>instal: Una vez que instaló daisyUI, puede usar clases de componentes como btn, card, etc.
So instead of making a button using only: Entonces, en lugar de hacer un botón usando solo clases de utilidad
You can just use a component class like: Puedes usar una clase de componente como esta
Then you can modify the component with d: Luego puede modificar el componente con clases de utilidad adicionales de daisyUI
Or you can modify the component with Tai: O puede modificar el componente con las clases de utilidad de Tailwind CSS
All daisyUI colors can be used as utilit: All daisyUI colors can be used as utility classes. Just like any other Tailwind CSS color. For example you can use `primary` color with any of Tailwind CSS color utilities.
These CSS variables are being used inter: These CSS variables are being used internally for a specific component
To use a custom prefix, <a class='link': Para usar un prefijo personalizado, agregue el prefijo a la configuración
footer-tagline:
Biblioteca de componentes gratuitos
Para los marcos de trabajo CSS orientados a clases de utilidad
daisyUI adds a set of customizable color: daisyUI agrega un conjunto de nombres de colores personalizables a Tailwind CSS y estos nuevos colores usan variables CSS para los valores. Usando los nombres de los colores de daisyUI, obtienes el Modo Oscuro y aún más temas sin agregar un nuevo nombre de clase.
install-step-1: Instale daisyUI como un paquete de Node
daisyUI welcomes contributions from deve: daisyUI da la bienvenida a las contribuciones de los desarrolladores de todo el mundo
Tailwind Play example page: Página de ejemplo de Tailwind Play
If it's true, components will have color: Si es true, los componentes tendrán colores y estilo, por lo que no necesitará diseñar nada.
If it's false, components will have no c: Si es false, los componentes no tendrán color ni estilo visual para que pueda diseñar su propio estilo.
If it's true, all themes will be include: Si es true, se incluirán todos los temas.
If it's false, only light and dark theme: Si es false, solo estarán disponibles los temas claro y oscuro.
If it's an array, only themes in the arr: Si es un array, solo se incluirán los temas contenidos en este y el primer tema será el predeterminado.
If it's true, daisyUI shows logs in the: Si es true, daisyUI muestra registros en la terminal mientras se construye el CSS
Adds a prefix to class name for all dais: Agrega un prefijo al nombre de clase para todas las clases de daisyUI (incluidas las clases de componentes, las clases de modificadores y las clases de respuesta).
If you're using a second CSS library tha: Si está utilizando una segunda biblioteca CSS que tiene nombres de clase similares, puede usar esta configuración para evitar conflictos.
daisyUI comes with a number of themes, w: daisyUI viene con una serie de temas, que puede usar sin esfuerzo adicional.
Each theme defines a set of colors which: Cada tema define un conjunto de colores que se usarán en todos los elementos daisyUI.
You can only include the themes you want: Puede incluir solo los temas que desee en su proyecto.
This will reduce the size of your CSS fi: Esto reducirá el tamaño de su archivo CSS.
In the below example, I have the require: En el siguiente ejemplo, tengo los colores requeridos. Todos los demás colores se generarán automáticamente (como el color del botón cuando se enfoca en él o el color del texto en un botón principal).
There are a few optional CSS variables t: Hay algunas variables CSS opcionales que puede usar en los temas daisyUI para personalizar diseño de cada tema:
Custom CSS for a daisyUI theme: CSS personalizado para un tema daisyUI
You can apply custom style to a daisyUI: Puede aplicar un estilo personalizado a un tema daisyUI usando CSS:
Artboard provides fixed size container t: Artboard proporciona un contenedor de tamaño fijo para mostrar un contenido de demostración en tamaño móvil.
Bottom navigation bar allows navigation: La barra de navegación inferior permite la navegación entre pantallas principales.
Button group shows buttons next to each: Button group muestra los botones uno al lado del otro.
Countdown gives you a transition effect: Countdown te da un efecto de transición de números cambiantes.
Input group puts an input next to a text: Input group pone una entrada al lado de un texto o un botón.
Stat is used to show numbers and data in: Stat se usa para mostrar números y datos en un cuadro.
You can also define optional colors to h: También puede definir colores opcionales para tener más control sobre los valores de color (por ejemplo: el color del botón cuando está enfocado del color del texto en un botón)
It handles everything and it's fully cus: Maneja todo y es totalmente personalizable.
daisyUI adds some style to @tailwindcss/: daisyUI agrega algo de estilo a @tailwindcss/typography para que use el mismo tema que otros elementos.
Changes the style of a component: Cambia el estilo de un componente.
Join is a container for grouping multipl: Join is a container for grouping multiple items, it can be used to group buttons, inputs, or any other element. Join applies border radius to the first and last item. Join can be used to create a horizontal or vertical list of items.
This button will have different sizes on: This button will have different sizes on different browser viewpoints
Modal that closes when clicked outside: Modal that closes when clicked outside
If you set max-width or the list gets la: If you set max-width or the list gets larger than the container it will scroll
to join the items together and handle bo: to join the items together and handle border radius automatically
This collapse works with focus. When div: This collapse works with focus. When div loses focus, it gets closed
This collapse works with checkbox instea: This collapse works with checkbox instead of focus. It needs to get clicked again to get closed.
Use Tailwind CSS `group` and `group-focu: Use Tailwind CSS `group` and `group-focus` utilities to apply style when parent div is focused
Use Tailwind CSS `peer` and `peer-checke: Use Tailwind CSS `peer` and `peer-checked` utilities to apply style when sibling checkbox is checked
opens on click using ID.showModal() meth: opens on click using ID.showModal() method. can be closed using ID.close() method
there is a second form with 'modal-backd: there is a second form with 'modal-backdrop' class and it covers the screen so we can close the modal when clicked outside
You can use any w-* and max-w-* utility: You can use any w-* and max-w-* utility class to customize the width
Modal works with a hidden checkbox and l: Modal works with a hidden checkbox and labels can toggle the checkbox so we can use another label tag with 'modal-backdrop' class that covers the screen so we can close the modal when clicked outside
Dialog modal with a close button at corn: Dialog modal with a close button at corner
Instead of working with click, it shows: Instead of working with click, it shows swap-on item if you add swap-active class name. You can add or remove swap-active class using JS
Install daisyUI as a Tailwind plugin: Install daisyUI as a Tailwind plugin
daisyUI adds a few base styles to your p: daisyUI adds a few base styles to your page.
daisyUI provides a few useful utility cl: daisyUI provides a few useful utility classes and CSS variables to help you use the library more effectively.

Now you can use daisyUI class names!: Now you can use daisyUI class names!
Install WordPress according to the Offic: Install WordPress according to the Official WordPress guide .
In this guide, we will use the WindPress: In this guide, we will use the WindPress plugin to install Tailwind CSS and daisyUI in a WordPress project.

Click the button to install the WordPres: Click the button to install the WordPress plugin.

Navigate to the WindPress dashboard by clicking the menu item in the WordPress admin sidebar.
Then, click the file on the explorer sidebar to open the file editor.

There are 3 ways to add daisyUI to your: There are 3 ways to add daisyUI to your Rails project
This method is recommended if are alread: This method is recommended if are already using Node.js. This works as a Tailwind CSS plugin so only the class names you need will be added to your CSS file.
Initialize a package.json (if you don't: Initialize a package.json (if you don't have one) and install daisyUI

What's the difference between daisyUI an: What's the difference between daisyUI and Tailwind CSS?
Is daisyUI aligned with Tailwind CSS' ut: Is daisyUI aligned with Tailwind CSS' utility-first philosophy?

Can I use daisyUI without Tailwind CSS?: Can I use daisyUI without Tailwind CSS?
Can I use daisyUI with other UI framewor: Can I use daisyUI with other UI frameworks?
Which frameworks can I use daisyUI with?: Which frameworks can I use daisyUI with?
daisyUI is a collection of CSS class nam: daisyUI is a collection of CSS class names. These class names are a high-level abstraction of Tailwind CSS utility classes. Imagine you use Tailwind CSS with superpowers!
daisyUI is a NPM package, you can instal: daisyUI is a NPM package, you can install it as a dev dependency in your project. Then you add it to Tailwind CSS as a plugin. This makes all the daisyUI class names available to Tailwind CSS and you can use them like any other Tailwind CSS class names.
daisyUI uses the Tailwind CSS plugin API: daisyUI uses the Tailwind CSS plugin API to extend the available Tailwind CSS class names. This means that daisyUI is fully compatible with Tailwind CSS and you can use it with any Tailwind CSS project.
daisyUI is for you if you:: daisyUI is for you if you:
Are tired of writing thousands of utilit: Are tired of writing thousands of utility class names repeatedly
Want more readable and maintainable code: Want more readable and maintainable code
Need to design interfaces faster with le: Need to design interfaces faster with less code
Want a consistent design system across p: Want a consistent design system across projects
Want to use standard UI parts, without m: Want to use standard UI parts, without making design decisions for every single detail
Want dark mode and many other themes ava: Want dark mode and many other themes available out of the box
Want to use a design system that is base: Want to use a design system that is based on real-world UI design principles
Want development speed and customization: Want development speed and customization at the same time
daisyUI is not for you if you:: daisyUI is not for you if you:
Want to waste time re-inventing all the: Want to waste time re-inventing all the standard UI parts like buttons, cards, checkboxes, etc, for each project.
Want to swim in the ocean of thousands o: Want to swim in the ocean of thousands of class names and never find your way out.
Want to make your codebase a mess and sp: Want to make your codebase a mess and spend hours figuring out what part of the code is responsible for what part of the UI.
Want to waste your time and money re-inv: Want to waste your time and money re-inventing the wheel instead of shipping your actual project.
Tailwind CSS provides low-level utility: Tailwind CSS provides low-level utility classes, which usually include only one CSS rule. daisyUI classes are a combination of multiple CSS rule that are named semantically for each part of the UI.
For example Tailwind CSS class names dec: For example Tailwind CSS class names decide if padding should be 4px or 8px. daisyUI class names decide if a HTML element should look like a "card", a "button", a "toggle", etc, just like what we would call them semantically in a design system.
This makes it easier to design interface: This makes it easier to design interfaces with less code and more consistency. For example if you want to make a card using Tailwind CSS you would have to write one or multiple utility class names for each single CSS rule. Doing this over and over again for each element, for each page, for each project is time consuming and hard to manage. It also makes it harder to maintain your code as you have to always figure out what part of the code is responsible for what part of the UI.
daisyUI solves this problem by providing: daisyUI solves this problem by providing higher level class names that are named based on the UI parts. For example to make a card, we simply use the class name and daisyUI gives you all the necessary CSS rules to make a card. Then if you need additional customization, you can add Tailwind CSS utility classes to the element to make it look the way you want.
daisyUI is not a replacement for Tailwin: daisyUI is not a replacement for Tailwind CSS, it's a plugin that makes Tailwind CSS more powerful and easier to use.
daisyUI is built on top of Tailwind CSS': daisyUI is built on top of Tailwind CSS's component API. Tailwind CSS as a library provides utility classes and suggests using utility classes for maximum flexibility and customization. However that's means slower development and more code to write. That's why many people find it hard to use Tailwind CSS for designing interfaces. It takes a professional designer to make design decisions for many details of the UI to make them look good. It also takes a lot of time to write all the utility class names for each part of the UI. Even copying and pasting those huge chunks of utility class names is not helpful, as it makes the codebase hard to read and maintain.
Imagine one side of the spectrum is maxi: Imagine one side of the spectrum is maximum customization and flexibility and you should make design decisions for every single detail. On the other side of the spectrum is maximum development speed and less code to write, but you have no control over the design. daisyUI and Tailwind CSS together give you the best of both worlds. Use daisyUI class names to write less code and develop faster, and use Tailwind CSS utility classes to customize the design when you need to.
Is it full circle? If you've been using: Is it full circle? If you've been using Bootstrap many years ago, you may think it doesn't make sense to go back to using components.
But here's the catch: The problem with B: But here's the catch: The problem with Bootstrap was not class names! Bootstrap class names were actually really fast to work with. The problem was lack of customization and flexibility. At some point every Bootstrap website looked the same unless you open a CSS file and write tons of custom CSS. Tailwind CSS solves this problem of customization and flexibility but the cost is slower development and more code to write! You wanted customization and flexibility? Good luck making design decisions for every single pixel in your page! Not a practical approach, right?
We need customization development speed: We need customization development speed at the same time. daisyUI is here to make this possible.
Atomic Design is a methodology for creat: Atomic Design is a methodology for creating design systems. It breaks down the UI into smaller parts, like atoms, molecules, organisms, etc.
You can think of Tailwind CSS utility cl: You can think of Tailwind CSS utility classes as atoms. They are the smallest parts of the UI that you can use to build larger parts. daisyUI classes are like molecules and organisms. They are higher-level abstractions of the UI parts that are made of atoms.
Larger parts of the UI, like templates a: Larger parts of the UI, like templates and pages are quickly possible by putting these molecules and organisms together in layouts, using grid or flexbox, and adding functionality and content to them.
Yes, daisyUI is free and open-source, un: Yes, daisyUI is free and open-source, under the MIT license. You can use it in any project, commercial or non-commercial, without any restrictions.
Why is it free? daisyUI's goal is to imp: Why is it free? daisyUI's goal is to improve the web development experience for everyone. I believe web development is already complex enough with all the different technologies, frameworks and tools. It takes a lot of time and effort to learn and master all these tools. daisyUI is here to make the design part of web development easier and faster, so you can focus on the actual product you are building.
You can support daisyUI by using it in y: You can support daisyUI by using it in your projects, sharing it with your friends and colleagues, and contributing to the project on GitHub. You can also support daisyUI by becoming a sponsor on GitHub or Open Collective.
Yes, daisyUI can be used standalone with: Yes, daisyUI can be used standalone without Tailwind CSS. However, it's recommended to use daisyUI with Tailwind CSS. Here's why: daisyUI provides pieces of UI you can use to make a website. Like Button, Toggle, Card, etc. You need something to glue these pieces together! For example you need flex box, grid, padding, margin, etc. Tailwind CSS provides these low-level utility classes that you can use to glue the UI pieces together. So daisyUI and Tailwind CSS are a perfect match. You can use daisyUI to design the UI parts and Tailwind CSS for layout, spacing, font-size and other low-level CSS rules.
Alternatively if you don't want to use T: Alternatively if you don't want to use Tailwind CSS, you can use daisyUI for components and write your own styles for layout, spacing, etc.
Yes, you can mix and match daisyUI with: Yes, you can mix and match daisyUI with any UI framework that add styles based on class names. If there's any class name conflict, you can use prefix to avoid conflicts between two libraries.
ALL of them! daisyUI is framework agnost: ALL of them! daisyUI is framework agnostic. You can use it anywhere you can use CSS.
daisyUI can be configured from your CSS: daisyUI can be configured from your CSS file.
Replace the semicolon after with bracket: Replace the semicolon after with brackets and add the configuration inside the brackets.

In above example, we set the CSS variabl: In above example, we set the CSS variables on instead of . This way all daisyUI global CSS variables will be scoped to . This is useful to use daisyUI in a scoped environment like a web component or a shadow DOM or a specific part of the page.
In above example, we only include the bu: In above example, we only include the button, input, and select components. All other styles of daisyUI library will be excluded. Here are the file names you can include or exclude .
In above example, we exclude the style w: In above example, we exclude the style which is added to the when a modal or drawer is open.
In above example, we exclude the the lis: In above example, we exclude the the listed files. All other parts of daisyUI will be available to use. This is useful if you want to opt out of some parts of daisyUI or if you want to mix daisyUI for some parts and another library for the rest. Here are the file names you can include or exclude .
In above example, all daisyUI classes wi: In above example, all daisyUI classes will be prefixed with . For example, will be .
In above example, we disable the logs of: In above example, we disable the logs of daisyUI. This is useful if you want to clean up the console output.
string or comma separated list or `false: string or comma separated list or `false` or `all`
List of themes to enable. Use `false` to: List of themes to enable. Use `false` to disable all themes. Use `all` to enable all themes. Add `--default` flag next to a theme name to set it as default theme. Add `--prefersdark` flag next to a theme name to set it as default theme for dark mode.
The CSS selector to receive the CSS vari: The CSS selector to receive the CSS variables.
Make sure you're not using dynamic class: Make sure you're not using dynamic class names (half-variable like ). If you do this, there is no way for Tailwind CSS to find your class names.
Using Tailwind CSS and daisyUI, it is ex: Using Tailwind CSS and daisyUI, it is expected for CSS files to be very small. Ideally only the class names you used must be in the CSS file. Sometimes (specially in monorepos) it is possible that Tailwind CSS automatic class name detection finds some unwanted strings in your project and generate styles for them. To avoid this, you can disable automatic detection and register your source files using directive.
Probably you're using (or another style: Probably you're using (or another style or plugin) that is affecting form elements. daisyUI applies styles to class names but by default, applies styles to all form elements. If you really need alongside with daisyUI (which I doubt, because both are doing the same job) consider using its config so it only applies style to the elements with specific class name (not all form elements)
Enable a theme using on your tag:: Enable a theme using on your tag:
If you're using a custom theme make sure: If you're using a custom theme make sure you're using all the required CSS variables
With daisyUI, you don't need to manually: With daisyUI, you don't need to manually set colors using variant As long as you use daisyUI colors they will work on all themes, light or dark. If you really want to use Tailwind's variant, here's how to do it .
All daisyUI colors can be used as utilit: All daisyUI colors can be used as utility classes. Just like any other Tailwind CSS color. For example you can use color with any of Tailwind CSS color utilities.
You can use to set the background color: You can use to set the background color to the primary color and to set the text color to the primary color.
You can also control the opacity of the: You can also control the opacity of the color like
Tailwind CSS provides fixed values for b: Tailwind CSS provides fixed values for border radius, such as , , , etc. daisyUI provides a few more border radius values which are tokenized for components and can be customized based on the theme.
Change the theme to see the border radiu: Change the theme to see the border radius changes:
creates a glass effect on the element.
These CSS variables can be customized fo: These CSS variables can be customized for each themes. Read more about color names .
For advanced use: These CSS variables ar: For advanced use: These CSS variables are being used internally for a specific components. You probably won't need to customize them, but you can if you want to.
If you are using a prefix for daisyUI, t: If you are using a prefix for daisyUI, these CSS variables will be prefixed with that prefix as well. For example if prefix is , The CSS variable will be .
These variables are for internal use. Th: These variables are for internal use. They are not subject of semantic versioning and some of them may be modified or removed in future minor versions, in which case your custom styles might lose their effect, so if you want to modify these variables and your UI really depends on the customized value, make sure you are using a fixed version of daisyUI, not the latest version.
:INFO: These variables are for internal: :INFO: These variables are for internal use. They are not subject of semantic versioning and some of them may be modified or removed in future minor versions, in which case your custom styles might lose their effect, so if you want to modify these variables and your UI really depends on the customized value, make sure you are using a fixed version of daisyUI, not the latest version.

These components automatically set the c: These components automatically set the correct background color, text color, border color, etc as needed so you don't need to set those colors manually. is the the text color of the page by def: is the the text color of the page by default. It's a dark color on light themes and it's a light color on dark themes.

The advantage of using opacity is that i: The advantage of using opacity is that it gives a constant result on all themes, for all colors. You can use it with any opacity value, you can use it for any color. For example primary-content:

Layout, sizing, grids, spacing, etc. all: Layout, sizing, grids, spacing, etc. all will be handled by Tailwind CSS's utility classes. Read more at Tailwind CSS documentation: Layout , Sizing , Flexbox , Grid , Box alignment , Spacing
daisyUI supports the TailwindCSS Typogra: daisyUI supports the TailwindCSS Typography plugin All parts are compatible with daisyUI themes.
Here's a demo text to demonstrate the Ta: Here's a demo text to demonstrate the Tailwind CSS Typography plugin in combination with daisyUI colors:
This is a demo of the Tailwind CSS Typog: This is a demo of the Tailwind CSS Typography plugin in action. The plugin provides a set of prose classes that can be used to style your HTML content with minimal effort. When combined with daisyUI, you get access to a variety of themes that are fully compatible with the Typography plugin.
Headers are essential for structuring yo: Headers are essential for structuring your content and making it easy to read. With Tailwind CSS Typography and daisyUI, you can create headers that stand out and match your chosen theme.
Text formatting is crucial for emphasizi: Text formatting is crucial for emphasizing important information. Tailwind CSS Typography makes it simple to apply bold, italic, and other text styles.
Bold text is perfect for highlighting ke: Bold text is perfect for highlighting key points.
Italic text is great for emphasizing spe: Italic text is great for emphasizing specific words.
Bold and Italic text can be used for ext: Bold and Italic text can be used for extra emphasis.
Blockquotes are an excellent way to high: Blockquotes are an excellent way to highlight quotes or important information. They are styled beautifully with the Typography plugin.
\"This is a blockquote. It stands out an: "This is a blockquote. It stands out and draws attention to important information. In HTML, blockquotes are created using the tag. When used with the Typography plugin and daisyUI, blockquotes receive special styling that includes indentation and a different background color - making quoted text visually distinct from the rest of the content. This styling helps create clear visual hierarchy and improves readability while maintaining semantic HTML markup."
Lists are a great way to organize inform: Lists are a great way to organize information in a structured manner. Tailwind CSS Typography makes it easy to create both unordered and ordered lists.
Unordered lists use bullet points to lis: Unordered lists use bullet points to list items. They are perfect for listing items without a specific order.
Ordered lists use numbers to list items. They are ideal for steps or items that need to be in a specific order.
Links are essential for navigation and a: Links are essential for navigation and adding interactivity to your content. Tailwind CSS Typography ensures that links are styled consistently.
Images are a great way to enhance your c: Images are a great way to enhance your content visually. The Typography plugin makes sure they are displayed beautifully.
Code snippets are crucial for technical: Code snippets are crucial for technical content. Tailwind CSS Typography provides excellent styling for both inline code and code blocks.
Inline code is perfect for highlighting: Inline code is perfect for highlighting small pieces of code within a sentence.
Here is an example of inline code:: Here is an example of inline code:
Code blocks are ideal for displaying lar: Code blocks are ideal for displaying larger pieces of code. You can use Shiki, Prism or other libraries for code highlighting.
Tables are essential for organizing data: Tables are essential for organizing data in rows and columns. Tailwind CSS Typography ensures that tables are styled consistently and look great.
daisyUI provides various color schemes t: daisyUI provides various color schemes that you can use to add vibrancy to your content. Here are some examples:
Styling your Markdown-generated HTML has: Styling your Markdown-generated HTML has never been easier, thanks to the Tailwind CSS Typography plugin and daisyUI themes. By using headers, text formatting, lists, links, images, code snippets, tables, and colors, you can create rich and visually appealing content with minimal effort. Experiment with these elements and see how they look with different daisyUI themes. Happy styling!

There are 3 methods to use a dropdowns: There are 3 methods to use a dropdowns
Method 2. popover API and anchor positio: Method 2. popover API and anchor positioning
details and summary are native HTML elem: details and summary are native HTML elements that can be used to create dropdowns. Dropdown using details and summary opens and closes the content when the summary is clicked. You can also open/close it using JS by adding/removing the attribute
Popover API is the new HTML standard for: Popover API is the new HTML standard for creating dropdowns. It opens the dropdown on a top layer, which means there's no need to z-index management and there's no overflow issue. Anchor positioning is a new CSS standard for positioning elements relative to an anchor.
is the unique ID of the popover content. / is the unique name of the anchor.
CSS Anchor Positioning is a new standard: CSS Anchor Positioning is a new standard but isn't yet supported in Firefox and Safari ( caniuse.com ). In those browsers, the dropdown will appear centered like a modal. There's also this polyfill that can be helpful.
The content gets displayed when the butt: The content gets displayed when the button is focused.
Why div? Safari has a CSS bug since 2008:
Why div? Safari has a CSS bug since 2008 that prevents button elements from being focused, so we use div as a workaround.
This approach is accessible with the addition of and functions consistently across all browsers.
This dropdown closes when focus is lost. Avoid placing elements in it that remove focus from dropdown content. For example a element inside the dropdown.

:INFO: Why div? Safari has a CSS bug sin:
:INFO: Why div? Safari has a CSS bug since 2008 that prevents button elements from being focused, so we use div as a workaround.
This approach is accessible with the addition of and functions consistently across all browsers.
:INFO: This dropdown closes when focus i: :INFO: This dropdown closes when focus is lost. Avoid placing elements in it that remove focus from dropdown content. For example a element inside the dropdown.
Change screen size to show/hide menu: Change screen size to show/hide menu
Sidebar is always visible on large scree: Sidebar is always visible on large screen, can be toggled on small screen because of lg:drawer-open class
Drawer is a grid layout that can show/hi: Drawer is a grid layout that can show/hide a sidebar on the left or right side of the page, based on the screen size or based on the value of a checkbox. Drawer must be the parent element of the content and sidebar.
Drawer sidebar is hidden by default.\nYo:
Drawer sidebar is hidden by default.
You can make it visible on larger screens using class (or using other responsive prefixes: sm, md, lg, xl)
You can check/uncheck the checkbox using: You can check/uncheck the checkbox using JavaScript or by clicking the tag which is assigned to the hidden checkbox
Opening a drawer adds a scrollbar-gutter: Opening a drawer adds a scrollbar-gutter to the page to avoid layout shift on operating systems that have a fixed scrollbar. If you don't want to use this feature, you can exclude .

For pagination, we use join component to: For pagination, we use join component to show multiple links or buttons next to each other.
is a hidden radio at the start to allow: is a hidden radio at the start to allow users to remove their rating.
Items in each rating should have unique: Items in each rating should have unique attributes to avoid conflicts with other ratings on the same page.

daisyUI includes styles for 3 popular ca: daisyUI includes styles for 3 popular calendar libraries. Use any of them, based on your needs. You don't need to import the CSS files for these libraries. daisyUI will style them automatically.
Cally is a web component calendar and it: Cally is a web component calendar and it works everywhere. Read the docs

Each set of radio inputs should have uni: Each set of radio inputs should have unique attributes to avoid conflicts with other sets of radio inputs on the same page.

writing an invalid email address applies: writing an invalid email address applies error color to the input. Valid email address applies success color.
If value is invalid, a hint text appears: If value is invalid, a hint text appears below the input.
Click the button before picking an optio: Click the button before picking an option to see the error color.
class will be invisible if it comes afte: class will be invisible if it comes after a class, then if the input is invalid, will get visible. still occupies space even if it's invisible because we don't want a layout shift when the hint appears. If you prefer to hide the hint when it's not visible, add class to . It will take no space when it's hidden, and if input is invalid, it will appear and take space.

Even if join-item is not a direct child: Even if join-item is not a direct child of the group, it still gets the style
you need to change the span text and the: you need to change the span text and the CSS variable using JS. Value must be a number between 0 and 99.

Inputs can be used with class to have va: Inputs can be used with class to have validation styles. See Validator component for more details.
Accordion uses the same style as the col: Accordion uses the same style as the collapse component but it works with radio inputs. You can control which item to be open by checking/unchecking the hidden radio input.
:INFO: Accordion uses the same style as: :INFO: Accordion uses the same style as the collapse component but it works with radio inputs. You can control which item to be open by checking/unchecking the hidden radio input.
:INFO: All radio inputs with the same na: :INFO: All radio inputs with the same name work together and only one of them can be open at a time. If you have more than one set of accordion items on a page, use different names for the radio inputs on each set.
collapse-open and collapse-close doesn't: collapse-open and collapse-close doesn't work with this method. You can add/remove open attribute to the details instead
Use Tailwind CSS and utilities to apply: Use Tailwind CSS and utilities to apply style when parent div is focused
Use Tailwind CSS and utilities to apply style when sibling checkbox is checked
This slider works with anchor links so t: This slider works with anchor links so the browser will snap vertically to the image when you click buttons.

Radial progress needs CSS variable to wo: Radial progress needs CSS variable to work. To change the size, use CSS variable which has a default value of . To change the thickness, use CSS variable which is 10% of the size by default.
For Radial progress we need to use a ins: For Radial progress we need to use a instead of the tag because browsers can't show text inside tag, and Firefox doesn’t render pseudo-elements inside tag at all. Adding makes it accessible to screen readers as well.

you can open/close the submenu by adding: you can open/close the submenu by adding/removing menu-dropdown-show class using JS
Theme Controller changes the theme using: Theme Controller changes the theme using CSS only. You can then use JS to save the input state in the server or localStorage if you want it to persist on page refresh. Here's a React example to save checkbox state in local storage: Stackblitz

Using checkbox A hidden to control the s: Using checkbox A hidden to control the sate of modal and to check/uncheck the checkbox and open/close the modal
Using anchor links A link adds a paramet: Using anchor links A link adds a parameter to the URL and you only see the modal when the URL has that parameter
Opening a modal adds a scrollbar-gutter: Opening a modal adds a scrollbar-gutter to the page to avoid layout shift on operating systems that have a fixed scrollbar. If you don't want to use this feature, you can exclude .
HTML dialog element is a native way to c: HTML dialog element is a native way to create modals. It is accessible and we can close the modal using key. We can open the modal using JS method and close it using method. The ID must be unique for each modal.
A hidden checkbox can control the state: A hidden checkbox can control the state of modal and labels can toggle the checkbox so we can open/close the modal.
A link adds a parameter to the URL and y:
A link adds a parameter to the URL and you only see the modal when the URL has that parameter When modal is closed, the page will scroll to the top because of the anchor link.
Anchor links might not work well on some SPA frameworks. If there are problems, use the other methods
